summary.para: Begins an asynchronous request for the next event in the queue.
Call this method inside your implementation of . Pass the parameters from that method directly to this method.

param.name: pCallback
param.para: Pointer to the interface of a callback object.

param.name: punkState
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of a state object, defined by the caller. This parameter can be NULL. The object is returned to the caller when the callback is invoked.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Completes an asynchronous request for the next event in the queue.
Call this method inside your implementation of . Pass the parameters from that method directly to this method.

param.name: ppEvent
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the event object. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Retrieves the next event in the queue. This method is synchronous.
Call this method inside your implementation of . Pass the parameters from that method directly to this method.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Specifies whether the method blocks until an event is queued. For a list of valid flags, see .

param.name: ppEvent
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Puts an event in the queue.

param.name: pEvent
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the event to be put in the queue.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: Call this method when your component needs to raise an event that contains attributes. To create the event object, call . Add attributes to the event by using methods from the interface. (The interface inherits IMFAttributes.)
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Creates an event, sets an IUnknown pointer as the event data, and puts the event in the queue.

param.name: met
param.para: Specifies the event type of the event to be added to the queue. The event type is returned by the event's method. For a list of event types, see Media Foundation Events.

param.name: guidExtendedType
param.para: The extended type of the event. If the event does not have an extended type, use the value GUID_NULL. The extended type is returned by the event's method.

param.name: hrStatus
param.para: A success or failure code indicating the status of the event. This value is returned by the event's method.

param.name: pUnk
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface. The method sets this pointer as the event value. The pointer is returned by the event's method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: Call this method when your component needs to raise an event that contains an IUnknown pointer value and no attributes. If the event contains attributes, use instead.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Creates an event, sets a PROPVARIANT as the event data, and puts the event in the queue.
Call this method inside your implementation of . Pass the parameters from that method directly to this method.

You can also call this method when your component needs to raise an event that does not contain attributes. If the event data is an IUnknown pointer, you can use . If the event contains attributes, use instead.

param.name: met
param.para: Specifies the type of the event to be added to the queue. The event type is returned by the event's method. For a list of event types, see Media Foundation Events.

param.name: guidExtendedType
param.para: The extended type of the event. If the event does not have an extended type, use the value GUID_NULL. The extended type is returned by the event's method.

param.name: hrStatus
param.para: A success or failure code indicating the status of the event. This value is returned by the event's method.

param.name: pvValue
param.para: Pointer to a PROPVARIANT that contains the event value. This parameter can be NULL. This value is returned by the event's method.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: Call this method when your component shuts down. After this method is called, all methods return MF_E_SHUTDOWN.
This method removes all of the events from the queue.
This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.

summary.para: Provides an event queue for applications that need to implement the interface.

This interface is exposed by a helper object that implements an event queue. If you are writing a component that implements the interface, you can use this object in your implementation. The event queue object is thread safe and provides methods to queue events and to pull them from the queue either synchronously or asynchronously. To create the event queue object, call .

remarks.para: This interface is available on the following platforms if the Windows Media Format 11 SDK redistributable components are installed:

item.description: Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later.
Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005 with KB900325 (Windows XP Media Center Edition 2005) and KB925766 (October 2006 Update Rollup for Windows XP Media Center Edition) installed.
